column4: I tried to dual boot Ubuntu and Vista.  After intalled Vista, I get "BOOTMGR is compressed" and I cannot boot the system.  How do I recover the system with any Linux tools?
you put  Vista on after Ubuntu?
I install Ubuntu first, then Vista.
right ok so only Vista boots at the moment yes?
if you put  Windows on after  a Linux distro, it goes over the boot loader, so only   Windows can boot
no, no boot loader, just 'bootmgr is compressed' to reboot Ctl+Alt+DEL
ok  this sounds like a possible Windows issue,   or  maybe hard disk issue
Ubuntu was installed first, and then you put Vista on?
Yes, Ubuntu was intalled first, then Vista.
and for some reason the Vista boot loader is not working
ok well normally it's recommended to put Vista on first and then  Linux distro, becasue of how Windows goes  over the Grub boot loader
yes, it corrupt the bootloader, I think.
you might have to go to ##windows   if I can't help in pm,  pm since I will go a little off topic for this channel there
no it sounds like your Windows boot loader has gone bad
it won't help putting Grub on
,because when it comes to booting up Windows, it will use the boot loader you got on there now
